clinical_study.brief_title: RECO in the Endovascular Treatment of Acute Ischemic Stroke
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective ,Multicenter, Registry Study of RECO in the Endovascular Treatment of Acute Ischemic Stroke

brief_summary.textblock: Investigate Reco ® ,the first clot retriever in china as the primary therapyand remedies in the real world.

detailed_description.textblock: Endovascular thrombectomy (EVT) is effective and safe for acute ischemic stroke (AIS) caused by large vessel occlusion (LVO) in major clinical trials. Whether the benefit of EVT in randomized trials could be generalized to clinical practice, especially in developing countries, remains unknown. The Registry was established to evaluate the utilization, and subsequent outcomes of EVT treated AIS patients. This study is a multi-center, prospective registry study initiated by researchers, to investigate Reco ® ,the first clot retriever in china as the primary therapyand remedies in the real world.

primary_outcome.measure: Functional independence at 90 days (modified Rankin Scale of 0-2)
primary_outcome.description: The range of modified Rankin Scale was from 0 to 6. 0-No symptoms;1-No significant disability;2-Slight disability;3-Moderate disability;4-Moderately severe disability;5-Severe disability;6 -Dead.A higher score indicates worse a outcome.

primary_outcome.measure: Symptomatic intracranial hemorrhage (sICH) within 12-36 hours after the procedure
primary_outcome.description: Heidelberg Bleeding Classification): new intracranial hemorrhage detected by brain imaging associated with ≥4 points total National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS), ≥2 points in one NIHSS category, leading to intubation/ hemicraniectomy/ EVD placement or other major medical/surgical intervention, or absence of alternative explanation for deterioration

primary_outcome.measure: Time from symptom onset to recanalization
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the time of symptom onset until the time of of the recanalization of the occluded artery, assessed up to 48 hours

secondary_outcome.measure: Recanalization rate at the end of the procedure
Recanalization rate after the first attempt
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after the first attempt of endovascular treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in NIHSS score immediately after the procedure
secondary_outcome.description: difference between NIHSS score immediately after the procedure and baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in NIHSS score 24 hours after the procedure
secondary_outcome.description: difference between NIHSS score 24 hours after the procedure and baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in NIHSS score 7 days after the procedure or at discharge
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days after the procedure or discharge
secondary_outcome.description: difference between NIHSS score 7 days after the procedure or discharge and baseline

EQ-5D is a standardized instrument for measuring generic health status. Rated level can be coded as a number 1, 2, or 3, which indicates having no problems for 1, having some problems for 2, and having extreme problems for 3. As a result, a person's health status can be defined by a 5-digit number, ranging from 11111 (having no problems in all dimensions) to 33333 (having extreme problems in all dimensions).A higher score indicates a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Barthel index (BI) 90 days after the procedure
secondary_outcome.description: The BI has a score of 0-100. A higher score indicates a better outcome.
PH2 is defined as the rate of hematoma >30percent in infarct area

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, after arrival at the hospital immediately
At baseline, after taking any brain imaging immediately
At baseline, during the procedure, after successful groin puncture immediately
At baseline, during the procedure, after successful recanalization immediately

study_pop.textblock: Patients with acute ischemic stroke caused by large vessel occlusion and using RECO to receive endovascular treatment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age ≥ 18 years old
2. Diagnosis of acute ischemic stroke
3. Imaging confirmed intracranial large artery occlusion (LVO): intracranial internal carotid artery (ICA T/L), middle cerebral artery (MCA M1/M2), anterior cerebral artery (ACA A1/A2), basilar artery (BA), vertebral artery (VA V4), and posterior cerebral artery (PCA P1);ASPECT or PC-ASPECT ≥ 6
4. Initiation of any type of endovascular treatment (EVT), including intra-arterial thrombolysis, mechanical thrombectomy, angioplasty, and stenting
5. The patient or the patient's legal representative is able and willing to sign the informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Isolated cervical ICA or VA occlusion;
2. No evidence of LVO on DSA.

overall_official.affiliation: Capital Medical University, Beijing Tiantan Hospital
